title: Upgrade geth to 1.10.6-stable  restart geth but still can not sync to the latest block
body: Upgrade geth to 1.10.6-stable restart geth but still can not sync to the latest block , can some one help me out

1+ to this 


geth version check
Geth
Version: 1.10.6-stable
Git Commit: 576681f29b895dd39e559b7ba17fcd89b42e4833
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.16.4
Operating System: linux (ubuntu 20.04)


sudo journalctl -fu geth.service
geth[62452]: WARN [08-07|09:33:15.235] Served eth_chainId                       conn=127.0.0.1:39152 reqid=1 t="33.534Âµs"  err="chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block"

Am I missing something silly ?

@xiaomingloveqinger If you don't provide any details, there's not much we can do.

@DatLinuxGuy I guess you haven't finished syncing yet. The logs should give you an idea of where you're at wrt syncing. Without sharing those, not much we can say.

I think I'm having  the same issue. 
Any time I try to connect a Metamask wallet my node logs this error:
` err="chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block"`

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have more relevant information or answers to our questions so that we can investigate further.
